intro: Goniothalamus inaequilatera, commonly known as the unequal-sided goniothalamus, is a member of the family Annonaceae and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers with a distinctive, fragrant odor, typically arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
